page.title: 06The Village of South Leigh
page.content: outh Leigh is a small rural village, wo miles from Witney. It has an old hurch and a "listed" half-timbered arm house in the oldest part of the village. There is also an old school but now children are taken by bus to school at Cogges or Ducklington and the building is used for the Youth club. There are a few more houses around the church and more on the main road (about two dozen altogeter). Most houses are quite old although many have been enlarged and modernised. There is a large,well known restaurant and pub and also a village shop/post- office. Many people are related in the village and quite a lot work on farms. Sometimes the narrow lane to Witney gets blocked by snow in winter. There used to be industry such as wagon building and wheelwrights but now there is only agriculture.
